review_ratings_blob: 4.7 AROMA 9/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 10/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 19/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: This IPA hit all the right notes with me. The piney aroma greets the nose with an inviting greeting. Obviously, the dominant flavors are what you would expect from an IPA: citrus and pine on the hops side but toasty, nutty and bready on the malt side. This is just a delicious, flavorful IPA that I keep going back to. I love seeing an old guard brewery like Point hit one out of the park in the craft brewing realm.

review_ratings_blob: 4.4 AROMA 9/10 APPEARANCE 3/5 TASTE 9/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 18/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Pours a slightly cloudy orange color with a decent, but not exactly rocky head. Aroma was wonderfull piney, citrusy hops. Flavor was full-on but more balanced by sweet malt than the Hop Slam name would imply. Full-bodied, bracing hops flavors abound. This beer is great for the first three quarters of a glass but I found its attributes surprisingly faded for the last portion. Cant explain it. I love hoppy beers and this is a good one. Might have been a fluke. Ill try another bottle tonight. Quality and attention to detail is evident. This is a fine ale made with top-notch ingredients.

review_ratings_blob: 2.4 AROMA 5/10 APPEARANCE 3/5 TASTE 5/10 PALATE 2/5 OVERALL 9/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: As much as I wanted to love this beer, I was disappointed. I just tried the newly repackaged Augustiner with the big "A" on the label. The new packaging looks great, by the way. However, the beer was very ordinary at a time when Iron City Brewing Company should be striving to be extraordinary. Color was nice, coppery and very appealing. But the head faded quickly and the body was thin. I detected adjuncts in the flavor when this offering ought to be an all malt product if they want to earn credibility with craft drinkers. Flavor was bland with notes of caramel. Very sweet and malty. Not sure what style they were going for here but its definitely a light-bodied session lager. If the brewers would give this beer a decent dose of hops to give it at least some perceived bitterness and aroma, it would be a much better beer. Hop it up boys. One word of advice: CASCADES! This brewery still seems stuck in the mentality that all its beers need to be "drinkable" by the masses. When you hear the word "drinkable" used to describe a supposed craft beer, run for the hills. That means they arent serious about brewing a really great, flavorful beer. Theyre aiming for the Killians crowd. For a brewery that has brewed Samuel Adams under contract, they know what they need to do but they arent doing it. Theyre underestimating their customer base and potential for becoming more appealing. They needed to hit a homerun but ran out a single instead.

review_ratings_blob: 4.4 AROMA 8/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 18/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: This is a really good example of Doppelbock with rich caramel notes, a deep brown color, rocky tan head that lasts a long time. Alcohol content is fairly high as expected. Its very malty sweet as the style demands but Id like to see a little more balance and astringency as in Spatens Optimator, which I think is the quinticential doppelbock. Moerlein has really stepped up its quality and the boldness of its beers and this doppelbock is no exception. Great label, wonderful historic pedigree, they dont make a bad beer at Christian Moerlein and they keep getting better.

review_ratings_blob: 4 AROMA 6/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 17/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Dark red / brown in color. Head is an off-white, thick and rocky. Delicious malt flavors abound. Sweet maltiness dominates, as one would expect from a strong bock beer. This one is satisfying and doesnt disappoint. The perfect springtime companion. One of the better bock beers available in the region at any price.

review_ratings_blob: 4.5 AROMA 9/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 9/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 18/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Delicious pale ale reminiscent of a style of beer brewed in Cincinnati in an era of limited refrigeration and before the arrival of lager yeast. Presentation is outstanding with a beautiful brown / red color, a frothy tan head that lasts and lasts and leaves a fine lace pattern on the glass. Nice hops aroma is very inviting. Big malty flavor and body provide myriad of flavor notes. But the best part is a zesty hops flavor from healthy doses of Fuggles and Cascades. Overall, a well balanced and satisfying pale ale that loves to please.

review_ratings_blob: 4.7 AROMA 9/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 9/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 19/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob:
This one is a mainstay in my fridge. Cant beat the flavor to price ratio with any other pale ale. Outstanding hops aroma and flavor backed up by a nice malty body. This is what I expect from an American IPA...at half the price of Sierra Nevada and I think its better. For those who say they cant taste the hops, I think you must be smokers and youve tainted your taste buds. Lay off the Marlboros for a year or so and try this beer when your taste buds have healed.
Color is staw gold with red shades hiding in the center. Very nice effort from a great brewery in upstate NY.

review_ratings_blob: 3.9 AROMA 8/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: I enjoyed a six pack of this while on Hilton Head. This was a very nice and enjoyable pale ale. Perhaps a bit thinner than I prefer but Id definitely drink it again. Nice deep golden color with reddish hints. Good, long-lasting head and nice hoppy flavors that did not disappoint. Id recommend this out of all of the beers in the Piggly Wiggly cooler, I think I bought the best available on Hilton Head.

review_ratings_blob: 4 AROMA 9/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 15/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Very interesting beer but the coffee while pleasant in the beginning, wore on me as I drank this beer. Rich and drak brown in flavor, definite aroma of coffee. Flavor is that of Black Patent malt and roasted coffee. Fun but I couldnt enjoy this on a regular basis.

review_ratings_blob: 3.6 AROMA 5/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: I found this to be one of the more interesting beers at Moon River. The Rye adds complex and interesting flavors that mimick pale ale more than bock.

review_ratings_blob: 4 AROMA 7/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 17/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: I havent had this beer since it was taken over by Pittsburgh Brewing so Im rating the beer brewed in Evansville in the 1990s. Color is typical of a golden American pilsner. White head holds a little longer than the average light beer. Flavor is pleasant and big for a light beer. Hops bitters are noticeable and well balanced with a medium body. Adjuncts are there but not at the heart of the flavor. This is a nice light beer for everyday use.

review_ratings_blob: 3.7 AROMA 7/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Fine, dry pils that pours golden with a frothy white head. Beautiful in the glass. Nice aroma of hops and grass. Flavor at first reminded me of Pilsner Urquell but the malty body wasnt quite as firm. Therefore, the balance seemed a bit shy of perfection. Loved the hoppy flavor but it lacked body in the finish. Very enjoyable and would buy again but the price is a little north of my normal budget.

review_ratings_blob: 4.7 AROMA 9/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 10/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 19/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: This fine ale is taken to the extreme in the hops department similar to other well hopped ales like Blue Ridge HofFest but even bigger than that. Nice golden color with reddish tint in the middle. Healthy, frothy head and great hops aroma. Flavor is big, mostly bitter hops flavors but a good base of rich malt. This is a special treat at this price. Cant afford it all the time though. Earlier Rating: 11/12/2002 Total Score: 4This is a fun beer. Absolutely loaded with hops. A way over the top American IPA. If you enjoy extreme hoppy beers of this sort, you should try the Blue Ridge HopFest Brown Ale. I actually like it better than the HopDevil because it has the malty body of a brown to back up the intensity of insane quantities of hops.

review_ratings_blob: 2.4 AROMA 2/10 APPEARANCE 3/5 TASTE 6/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 10/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob:
A half-hearted effort at brewing a good light beer. Head fades quickly over a fizzy yellow body. Not much in the way of hops and barley here. Flavor is fair and refreshing but not on par with say Old Milwaukee Light or Strohs Light. Its flatter in flavor closer to Bud Light or something equally as ordinary.
This brewery knows its stuff when it comes to great packaging but they need to brew bigger, bolder beers that live up to the promise of the packaging. Lots of people will try it once because of the allure of the package but repeat buyers will be few.

review_ratings_blob: 2.8 AROMA 3/10 APPEARANCE 3/5 TASTE 5/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 14/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Packaging is outstanding but like many of the beers from this little brewery, the beer fell a little short of its potential. Color was typical pale yellow. Non-existent hops aroma, light-bodied with a cloying malt/corn sweetness. Not particularly well-balanced...it couldve used more hops to offset the sweetness. I like this brewerys great tradition but their beers are playing to the masses instead of going all the way and brewing really great beers for enthusiasts. Theyll never beat the big boys at their own game so they ought to narrow their focus to just great beer.

review_ratings_blob: 3.7 AROMA 5/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: I like this beer - for a light lager. It has more flavor and character than most light beers. Good golden color, holds a head longer than most of its type. Flavor has a bite! Like real beer should! Bud Light, Miller Lite and the others cant come close to this beer. Its quite good for the type.

review_ratings_blob: 4.5 AROMA 6/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 10/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 19/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob:
This is an authentic malty Oktoberfest/Marzen/Vienna-style lager.
Ive enjoyed it from the bottle and on tap.
Color is amber. The head is frothy and long-lasting. Rich malt flavors abound (true to the style) with a noticeable flavor of alcohol. This one has a kick!
Hops are subdued but they come through in all the right places.
I have it on good authority that next fall, this seasonal beer will be available in 12-oz. bottles instead of 7-ounce.
This brand is primarily found in Greater Cincinnati.

review_ratings_blob: 4.7 AROMA 9/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 9/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 19/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob:
Heres proof that an outstanding American Pale Ale can be had for a fair and affordable price.
Amber color with an off-white head is inviting. The aroma of fresh hops greets the nose giving an indication of good things to come. The flavor does not disappoint. This is a full-bodied pale ale that will impress the most serious hop heads if theyre being honest with themselves. 
This ale definitely skews to the hoppy side as an APA should but there is a firm, malty body to give a well rounded experience.
Ive seen this priced below $5.99 a six-pack and its easily as good or better than beers costing almost twice as much. 
I get the impression that the sales and marketing guys let the Brewmaster do what he wanted with this one. High Falls is to be commended! Ill bet this will give Saranac Pale some competition. Both are excellent and fairly priced.

review_ratings_blob: 3.4 AROMA 6/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 6/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 14/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob:
I like this beer because its an American original. Though not a true English-style porter, it is sort of a hybrid known as Pennsylvania Porter. Brewed with a lager yeast instead of top-fermented ale yeast, it is lacking in those mysterious flavors that ale yeasts seem to impart into a beer. However, it is medium-bodied, dark and very enjoyable. You have to appreciate this beer for what it is!! Not what is isnt. 
My favorite Pennsylvania porter is Stegmaier Porter from the Lion Brewery in Wilkes-Barre, but Yuenglings porter is a great effort with enough tradition to make up for any shortcomings.

review_ratings_blob: 4.6 AROMA 9/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 9/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 18/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: This is another excellent effort from Goose Island. This stout is always consistent, always rich, smooth and flavorful. Tastes range from chocolate to coffee with enough bitters to keep it interesting. Rich dark color with a healthy tan head. Looks great, smells great, tastes great. What more can you ask for? Its widely available around here and is often regularly on sale for as low as $5.99 a six-pack. Normally, priced at $6.99.

review_ratings_blob: 4.2 AROMA 7/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 17/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: This is a very good IPA and at a reasonably good value. I appreciate the lingering bitterness of the hops. Theres plenty of tang to go around just as youd expect. Good malty body is there but you have to get past the hops to find it...just as it should be with an IPA. What I really like about this IPA is that is readily available at a lot of retail outlets.

review_ratings_blob: 4.5 AROMA 7/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 9/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 19/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Hops aroma greets the drinker before the first sip. Color is amber with a very respectable tan head. Flavors abound in this medium-bodied beer. Nice dose of hops leads the charge but it's backed up by a rich malty body. The blend creates a refreshing and delicious treat. It reminds me of Anchor Steam but maybe better. What is so great about the Saranac beers is that they're a bargain at just $4.99 a six pack and the quality is as good as beers costing twice as much. Great effort from F.X. Matt, one of the nation's few remaining old line regional brewers.

review_ratings_blob: 4.2 AROMA 7/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 17/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: UPDATED: MAR 29, 2008

review_ratings_blob: 3.8 AROMA 6/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Nice, enjoyable dark lager. You can taste the dry, bitterness of black malt. Light on the hops but the texture is good anyway. A little shallow in the middle but it finishes well.

review_ratings_blob: 3.5 AROMA 5/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 6/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: At $5.99 a six pack this is one of the most interesting beers available at the local Kroger store. Rich, malty and enjoyable. Nice amber color with a full, frothy head on top. Nice warming quality to this brew. Though not the greatest Marzen I've ever had this is certainly worth enjoying from time to time...especially at this price. Hell, Heineken, Corona and Becks cost much more and they can't touch this beer on flavor.

review_ratings_blob: 3.3 AROMA 4/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 14/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: They didn't just make a "me-too" light beer at Shiner. This has a deep golden color, which gives this beer the appearance of an all malt offering. Nice malty flavors are detectible, not much in the way of hops but enough to make it one of the most interesting light beers available.

review_ratings_blob: 3.6 AROMA 7/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 13/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: About what you'd expect from a solid German Hefe. Nice aroma, citrus tang and flavor. The head holds up firm and fluffy. This is a solid offering from the old country but there are a fair number of U.S. offerings that are just as good and better.

review_ratings_blob: 3.9 AROMA 7/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: I enjoyed this Texas brew. Didn't appear to be filtered. A distinctive rye ale that had a substantial dose of Cascade hops accented with a full malt body. The flavor comes on strong and fast and lingers for a while. Good enough for a second look. I'd buy this again in a heartbeat. Well done.
beer_name: Real Ale Full Moon Pale Rye Ale

review_ratings_blob: 3.6 AROMA 6/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 15/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Nice Czech pilsner...the way it's supposed to be done for any of those Anheuser-Busch execs reading this. A tawny golden color, reminiscent of an all malt brew. Looks a lot like a helles in color. Frothy head. Rich malty body with a fair dose of hops bitterness give this beer a distinct body that keeps you coming back for more. Nicely done.

review_ratings_blob: 4.6 AROMA 8/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 10/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 18/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: This was a great pale ale but if these other two ratings happened recently then they're not getting the full picture because this beer was taken from the market back in 1997. On draft, this was one of the finest American pale ales around. It had great doses of Cascade hops not quite balanced by rich and sweet malty flavors. Deep red color was very inviting. Mmmm, I could drink it again and again and I really miss this beer.

review_ratings_blob: 4.6 AROMA 8/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 10/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 18/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob:
This is a great porter. Deep, dark color with a firm, long lasting head. Leaves a nice Brussels lace pattern behind. 
Flavor notes range from chocolate to coffee and espresso. Light hops bitterness is present and never forgotten throughout the glass. 
This porter never loses its oooommmph from start to finish. And at $6.99 a six pack this one is going to be a regular for me.

review_ratings_blob: 3.8 AROMA 5/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: This is a great beer when it's fresh. I could do without the green bottles though. Just had one recently that was really impressive. Good firm body, enough hops to give that tasty tingle but well balanced with rich malt. This pilsner has the color of a good Munich helles...a shade or two darker than most pilsners. Nice.

review_ratings_blob: 4.3 AROMA 7/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 9/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 18/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Delicious and fresh. Reddish color, beautiful frothy head, subdued but apparent carbonation. Great flavor and plenty of hops.

review_ratings_blob: 4.4 AROMA 7/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 9/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 18/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Excellent stout. So smooth that it seems like a hybrid sweet stout and Irish dry stout. Rick, the brewer, does a fine job with all the B.H. beers and this one is no exception. Rich, coffee and chocolate flavors are evident. Just the right amount of bitterness. Very warming, firm and enjoyable.

review_ratings_blob: 1.9 AROMA 1/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 5/10 PALATE 2/5 OVERALL 7/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: I wanted to like this beer. Great label, good color in the glass but for a Vienna-style, this is far too light and tasteless. For $6.99 a sixer I expect an authentic beer. Dos Equis Amber isn't bad as a complement to fajitas but I wouldn't pay the high price on a regular basis...in fact never again when I can get a good authentic microbrew for the same price and ten times the flavor.

review_ratings_blob: 1 AROMA 2/10 APPEARANCE 1/5 TASTE 3/10 PALATE 1/5 OVERALL 3/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: What a shame that brewery execs think they know more than the Brewmaster? I suspect the marketing pukes had a hand in this scam. After all, who "cold-lagers" an ale. A stout by definition is an ale and cannot be lagered. They put the same statement on their pale ale. What can I say that hasn't already been said? It's thin and I suspect it is simply a colored and flavored pilsner. The little brewery in Cold Spring, Minnesota makes this brand for grocery stores to sell as a proprietary brand but somewhere along the way they forgot that their first priority should be brewing authentic, high-quality beers that live up to their packaging. Sadly, this one doesn't. It didn't even fizz when I popped the top. Gluek / Cold Spring makes some decent beers under different labels but they should go back to the Brewmaster on this so-called stout.

review_ratings_blob: 3.9 AROMA 5/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 17/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: I like it! What sets this American standard apart from the pack is that it's brewed with 2-Row barley instead of the cheaper six-row used in Bud, Miller and the like. The beer has a rounder flavor, deeper color and a bolder body. Hops are light but they play their role and give this lager a nice balance. This is a very enjoyable everyday beer that deserves our support.

review_ratings_blob: 3.4 AROMA 3/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob:
Narragansett is a victim of comments made by the very people that should be supporting it. It's far better than similar style beers from A-B and Miller. It has a good flavor for a golden American lager. It may even have a higher dose of hops. I taste 'em and I think it has a pretty good balance for the style. 
If you go to any metro area and buy the local brand name, there's always some wise ass in a sleeveless shirt carrying a 12-pack of Bud to the counter. He looks at you with the local brew and says, "that stuff sucks." And I think to myself, that's the pot calling the kettle black." People, this is a perfectly good golden lager and it's cheaper than the national brand crap that you've been brainwashed into drinking. Neighbor, try a 'gansett again."

review_ratings_blob: 2 AROMA 3/10 APPEARANCE 3/5 TASTE 4/10 PALATE 2/5 OVERALL 8/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Great color but it was downhill from there. Sweet, sugary and watery body. It could use a hardy concentration of malt and a strong dose of hops. It was a bit thin as though the brewery were on wartime rations with the ingredients. It's a small step in the right direction for Canadian brewers but it's no giant leap for beer-kind.

review_ratings_blob: 2.3 AROMA 4/10 APPEARANCE 3/5 TASTE 5/10 PALATE 2/5 OVERALL 9/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Well, I don't know if I'd really classify this as a "Pale Ale." There isn't enough hops character to make me believe it's a pale ale. Nice color, good presentation with the packaging but it just didn't deliver anything beyond the ordinary. I have one word of advice: HOPS!

review_ratings_blob: 2.5 AROMA 4/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 5/10 PALATE 2/5 OVERALL 10/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Nice packaging. The Rickard's beers are training beers for novices just venturing into the craft beer world. Honey Brown looks good in the glass with an attractive brown color. However, it's mild malty flavor could use a dose of Cascades to give it some balance and excitement. I had higher hopes for this one. It's packaging promised more than the beer inside delivered. But I'll say this for it, it sure is nice to see something on the store shelves in Canada besides the usual slop from Labatt and Molson. I know Rikard is associated with Molson but this is a good first step in a new direction away from high powered, malt liquor-like golden lagers.

review_ratings_blob: 3.5 AROMA 4/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: For the style, this is an excellent beer. Good light beers are hard to come by but this one is satisfying. Barely noticable adjuncts. Nice balanced flavor of malt and you can actually taste hops. They're not the main attraction but at least I detect the bitterness from them. They brew some nice beers at City Brewery and this one is satisfying to say the least.

review_ratings_blob: 3.7 AROMA 4/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 17/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: This is a great tasting American standard lager. It's fully krausened just as Old Style was. In fact, this is a lot like Old Style and that means it's a pretty damn good brew. Nice balance of malt and hops. I'm certain adjuncts are present but this beer doesn't taste corny or cheap. It's very refreshing. Straw color, average head. Cheers!

review_ratings_blob: 3.6 AROMA 6/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 15/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Ahhh! Nice dunkelweizen from Shiner. It's not as potent or hearty as some of the best winter ales but it is a great dunkelweizen. Nice flavors abound, mostly from the malts but with a light dose of hops too. This is a nice warmer for the occasional cold Texas nights.

review_ratings_blob: 3.7 AROMA 5/10 APPEARANCE 5/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: Hefeweizen isn't my favorite style but when in central Texas on a hot night, it's very refreshing and satisfying. I think it's a nice example of the style and would recommend it wholeheartedly. Good color, unfiltered, the way it should be. Nice yeasty fruit-like tones with a spritzy finish. Very enjoyable.

review_ratings_blob: 3.6 AROMA 4/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 5/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: I heard Pabst was making a bit of a comeback so I bought a six pack of longnecks and chilled them. I must say that Pabst is once again an excellent example of the American standard style. It's miles better than Budweiser or Miller and it has a nice balanced flavor. I'd definitely keep some around as a summertime lawnmowing beer. PBR is better now than it has tasted in years. I always thought the old Milwaukee-brewed PBR was much better than the version we used to get out of the Pearl plant in San Antonio but today's PBR is a nice, reasonably priced beer.

review_ratings_blob: 4.1 AROMA 8/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 8/10 PALATE 4/5 OVERALL 17/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: This IPA isn't as hoppy as many other American examples. I bought a six pack and drank the first bottle. I enjoyed it but wasn't particularly impressed, thinking it needed a higher dose of hops. The second bottle, a few days later, was much more impressive. The body was nice, flavor was very satisfying and the fuggles made for a nice round flavor. Last night I tried a third bottle and it was delicious. The beer continues to grow on me and I'll definitely buy it again.

review_ratings_blob: 2 AROMA 2/10 APPEARANCE 3/5 TASTE 5/10 PALATE 2/5 OVERALL 8/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: I've had worse but I've had a lot better. For the money, this is not a bad beer and the packaging is great. It looks upscale and if all you want is a plain old light beer, this one is just about as good as any and it sure as hell has more flavor than Bud Light or any of that sort of ilk.

review_ratings_blob: 2.6 AROMA 5/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 5/10 PALATE 2/5 OVERALL 10/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: At least it's accessable but I can't say that it's a great IPA. There simply aren't enough hops in it to qualify as a true IPA. I got a case on the US side of the border crossing and took it into Windsor. It sure beats Labatt or Molson but I was hoping for more. Color is good, flavor is light. Just enough character to tease you and leave you wanting more.

review_ratings_blob: 3.6 AROMA 6/10 APPEARANCE 4/5 TASTE 7/10 PALATE 3/5 OVERALL 16/20Beer Guy99(251)
review_blob: I tried this beer on tap at Legal Seafood on Long Island. It was easily the best beer in the place because it was about the only decent brew they had. Nice amber color, good floral nose. Hops bite was more than moderate but somewhat subdued for an American version of IPA. Nice and very drinkable. I'd definitely have another pint or two.
